required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of a Multivalent Pneumococcal Vaccine in Healthy Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 2, RANDOMIZED, DOUBLE-BLIND TRIAL TO EVALUATE THE SAFETY AND IMMUNOGENICITY OF A MULTIVALENT PNEUMOCOCCAL CONJUGATE VACCINE IN HEALTHY INFANTS

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of a Multivalent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants

detailed_description.textblock: NOTE: Detailed description has not been entered.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Local Reactions Within 7 Days After Vaccination 1
primary_outcome.description: Local reactions were recorded using an electronic diary. Local reactions included redness, swelling and pain at the injection site. Redness and swelling were measured and recorded in measuring device units. 1 measuring device unit =0.5 centimeter (cm). Redness and swelling were graded as mild (0.5 to 2.0 centimeter [cm]), moderate (greater than [>] 2.0 to 7.0 cm) and severe (>7.0 cm). Pain at injection site was graded as mild (hurt if gently touched example, whimpered, winced, protested, or withdrew), moderate (hurt if gently touched, with crying), and severe (caused limitation of limb movement).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Local Reactions Within 7 Days After Vaccination 2
primary_outcome.description: Local reactions were recorded using an electronic diary. Local reactions included redness, swelling and pain at the injection site. Redness and swelling were measured and recorded in measuring device units. 1 measuring device unit =0.5 cm. Redness and swelling were graded as mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm), moderate (>2.0 to 7.0 cm) and severe (>7.0 cm). Pain at injection site was graded as mild (hurt if gently touched example, whimpered, winced, protested, or withdrew), moderate (hurt if gently touched, with crying), and severe (caused limitation of limb movement).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Local Reactions Within 7 Days After Vaccination 3
primary_outcome.description: Local reactions were recorded using an electronic diary. Local reactions included redness, swelling and pain at the injection site. Redness and swelling were measured and recorded in measuring device units. 1 measuring device unit =0.5 cm. Redness and swelling were graded as mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm), moderate (>2.0 to 7.0 cm) and severe (>7.0 cm). Pain at injection site was graded as mild (hurt if gently touched example, whimpered, winced, protested, or withdrew), moderate (hurt if gently touched, with crying), and severe (caused limitation of limb movement).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Local Reactions Within 7 Days After Vaccination 4
primary_outcome.description: Local reactions were recorded using an electronic diary. Local reactions included redness, swelling and pain at the injection site. Redness and swelling were measured and recorded in measuring device units. 1 measuring device unit =0.5 cm. Redness and swelling were graded as mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm), moderate (>2.0 to 7.0 cm) and severe (>7.0 cm). Pain at injection site was graded as mild (hurt if gently touched example, whimpered, winced, protested, or withdrew), moderate (hurt if gently touched, with crying), and severe (caused limitation of limb movement).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 1
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as greater than or equal to (>=) 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 2
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as >= 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 3
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as >= 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 4
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as >= 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) From Vaccination 1 to 1 Month After Vaccination 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 1 to 1 month after Vaccination 3 (up to 5 months)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in study participants who received study vaccine without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) From Vaccination 4 to 1 Month After Vaccination 4
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 4 to 1 month after Vaccination 4
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in study participant who received study vaccine without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) From Vaccination 1 to 6 Months Following Vaccination 4
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 1 to 6 months after Vaccination 4 (up to 16 months)
primary_outcome.description: An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that results in death; is life-threatening (immediate risk of death); requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity (substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal life functions); results in congenital anomaly/birth defect.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Newly Diagnosed Chronic Medical Conditions (NDCMCs) From Vaccination 1 to 6 Months Following Vaccination 4
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 1 to 6 months after Vaccination 4 (duration of 16 months)
primary_outcome.description: An NDCMC is defined as a disease or medical condition, not previously identified, that is expected to be persistent or is otherwise long-lasting in its effects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Pre-specified Level of Pneumococcal IgG Concentrations Within 1 Month After Vaccination 3
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-specified levels of serotypes were as follows: for serotype 1, 3, 4, 6A, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F, 33F: >=0.35 microgram per milliliter, for serotype 5: >=0.23 microgram per milliliter, for serotype 6B: >=0.10 microgram per milliliter and for serotype 19A: >=0.12 microgram per milliliter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pneumococcal Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) at 1 Month After Vaccination 3
secondary_outcome.description: IgG GMCs were determined for each of the 20 pneumococcal serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F and 33F.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pneumococcal Serotype-specific IgG GMCs at 1 Month After Vaccination 4
secondary_outcome.description: IgG GMCs were determined for each of the 20 pneumococcal serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F and 33F.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female infant born at >36 weeks of gestation and aged 2 months (42 to 98 days) at the time of consent (the day of birth is considered day of life 1).
- Healthy infant determined by medical history, physical examination, and clinical judgment to be eligible for the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous vaccination with licensed or investigational pneumococcal vaccine.
- Prior receipt of diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, or polio vaccines.
- Previous receipt of >1 dose of hepatitis B vaccine.
- Prior hepatitis B vaccine must have been administered at age <30 days.
- Major known congenital malformation or serious chronic disorder. Receipt of blood/plasma products or immunoglobulins

facility.name: Children's Physicians, Creighton University Medical Center
Blue Ridge Pediatric and Adolescent Medicine, Inc.
Pediatric Associates of Mt. Carmel, Inc.
Oklahoma State University - Center for Health Sciences

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled from 16 April 2018 to 11 February 2020 in the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 460 participants of age greater than or equal to (>=) 42 to less than or equal to (<=) 98 days at baseline, were enrolled into the study. Out of these 460 participants, 458 participants received study treatment.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 milliliter (mL) intramuscular injection of 20-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (20vPnC) at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Medication error without associated adverse event

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.population: Dose 1 to Dose 3 safety population included participants who received Dose 1 and had safety follow up between Dose 1 and the blood draw visit 1 month after Dose 3. Here, "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" =participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 1
outcome.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as greater than or equal to (>=) 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).
outcome.population: Dose 1 to Dose 3 safety population included participants who received Dose 1 and had safety follow up between Dose 1 and the blood draw visit 1 month after Dose 3. Here, "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" =participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).
measure.population: Dose 1 to Dose 3 safety population included participants who received Dose 1 and had safety follow up between Dose 1 and the blood draw visit 1 month after Dose 3. Here, "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" =participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

class.title: Fever: >=38.0 degree C to 38.4 degree C
Fever: >38.4 degree C to 38.9 degree C
Fever: >38.9 degree C to 40.0 degree C

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 4
outcome.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as >= 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).
outcome.population: Dose 4 safety population included participants who received Dose 4 and had safety follow up between Dose 4 and 6 months after Dose 4. Here, "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" =participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Systemic Events Within 7 Days After Vaccination 4
measure.description: Systemic events included fever, decreased appetite, drowsiness, irritability and were recorded by using an electronic diary. Fever was defined as >= 38.0 degree Celsius (C) and categorized to >=38.0 to 38.4 degree C, >38.4 to 38.9 degree C, >38.9 to 40.0 degree C and >40.0 degree C. Decreased appetite was graded as mild (decreased interest in eating), moderate (decreased oral intake) and severe (refusal to feed). Drowsiness was graded as mild (increased or prolonged sleeping bouts), moderate (slightly subdued, interfered with daily activity) and severe (disabled, not interested in usual daily activity). Irritability was graded as mild (easily consolable), moderate (required increased attention) and severe (inconsolable; crying could not be comforted).
measure.population: Dose 4 safety population included participants who received Dose 4 and had safety follow up between Dose 4 and 6 months after Dose 4. Here, "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" =participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) From Vaccination 1 to 1 Month After Vaccination 3
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in study participants who received study vaccine without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 1 to 1 month after Vaccination 3 (up to 5 months)
outcome.population: Dose 1 to Dose 3 safety population included participants who received Dose 1 and had safety follow up between Dose 1 and the blood draw visit 1 month after Dose 3.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) From Vaccination 1 to 1 Month After Vaccination 3
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in study participants who received study vaccine without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
measure.population: Dose 1 to Dose 3 safety population included participants who received Dose 1 and had safety follow up between Dose 1 and the blood draw visit 1 month after Dose 3.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) From Vaccination 4 to 1 Month After Vaccination 4
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in study participant who received study vaccine without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 4 to 1 month after Vaccination 4
outcome.population: Dose 4 safety population included participants who received Dose 4 and had safety follow up between Dose 4 and 6 months after Dose 4.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) From Vaccination 4 to 1 Month After Vaccination 4
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in study participant who received study vaccine without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
measure.population: Dose 4 safety population included participants who received Dose 4 and had safety follow up between Dose 4 and 6 months after Dose 4.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) From Vaccination 1 to 6 Months Following Vaccination 4
outcome.description: An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that results in death; is life-threatening (immediate risk of death); requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity (substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal life functions); results in congenital anomaly/birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 1 to 6 months after Vaccination 4 (up to 16 months)
outcome.population: Overall safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine (20vPnC or 13vPnC) and had safety follow up in the study.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) From Vaccination 1 to 6 Months Following Vaccination 4
measure.description: An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that results in death; is life-threatening (immediate risk of death); requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity (substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal life functions); results in congenital anomaly/birth defect.
measure.population: Overall safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine (20vPnC or 13vPnC) and had safety follow up in the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Newly Diagnosed Chronic Medical Conditions (NDCMCs) From Vaccination 1 to 6 Months Following Vaccination 4
outcome.description: An NDCMC is defined as a disease or medical condition, not previously identified, that is expected to be persistent or is otherwise long-lasting in its effects.
outcome.time_frame: From Vaccination 1 to 6 months after Vaccination 4 (duration of 16 months)
outcome.population: Overall safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine (20vPnC or 13vPnC) and had safety follow up in the study.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Newly Diagnosed Chronic Medical Conditions (NDCMCs) From Vaccination 1 to 6 Months Following Vaccination 4
measure.description: An NDCMC is defined as a disease or medical condition, not previously identified, that is expected to be persistent or is otherwise long-lasting in its effects.
measure.population: Overall safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine (20vPnC or 13vPnC) and had safety follow up in the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Pre-specified Level of Pneumococcal IgG Concentrations Within 1 Month After Vaccination 3
outcome.description: Pre-specified levels of serotypes were as follows: for serotype 1, 3, 4, 6A, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F, 33F: >=0.35 microgram per milliliter, for serotype 5: >=0.23 microgram per milliliter, for serotype 6B: >=0.10 microgram per milliliter and for serotype 19A: >=0.12 microgram per milliliter.
outcome.population: Dose 3 evaluable immunogenicity population: included all eligible participants, who were randomly assigned to receive the vaccine, aged 42-98 days on the day of first vaccination, received 3 doses of assigned vaccine, had valid determinate IgG concentration for at least 1 serotype from 1 month after Dose 3 visit, had blood collection within 27-56 days, inclusive, after Dose 3, had not received prohibited vaccines before blood draw at 1 month after Dose 3, and had no major protocol deviations.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Pre-specified Level of Pneumococcal IgG Concentrations Within 1 Month After Vaccination 3
measure.description: Pre-specified levels of serotypes were as follows: for serotype 1, 3, 4, 6A, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F, 33F: >=0.35 microgram per milliliter, for serotype 5: >=0.23 microgram per milliliter, for serotype 6B: >=0.10 microgram per milliliter and for serotype 19A: >=0.12 microgram per milliliter.
measure.population: Dose 3 evaluable immunogenicity population: included all eligible participants, who were randomly assigned to receive the vaccine, aged 42-98 days on the day of first vaccination, received 3 doses of assigned vaccine, had valid determinate IgG concentration for at least 1 serotype from 1 month after Dose 3 visit, had blood collection within 27-56 days, inclusive, after Dose 3, had not received prohibited vaccines before blood draw at 1 month after Dose 3, and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Pneumococcal Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) at 1 Month After Vaccination 3
outcome.description: IgG GMCs were determined for each of the 20 pneumococcal serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F and 33F.
outcome.population: Dose 3 evaluable immunogenicity population: included all eligible participants, who were randomly assigned to receive the vaccine, aged 42-98 days on the day of first vaccination, received 3 doses of assigned vaccine, had valid determinate IgG concentration for at least 1 serotype from 1 month after Dose 3 visit, had blood collection within 27-56 days, inclusive, after Dose 3, had not received prohibited vaccines before blood draw at 1 month after Dose 3, and had no major protocol deviations.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Pneumococcal Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) at 1 Month After Vaccination 3
measure.description: IgG GMCs were determined for each of the 20 pneumococcal serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F and 33F.
measure.population: Dose 3 evaluable immunogenicity population: included all eligible participants, who were randomly assigned to receive the vaccine, aged 42-98 days on the day of first vaccination, received 3 doses of assigned vaccine, had valid determinate IgG concentration for at least 1 serotype from 1 month after Dose 3 visit, had blood collection within 27-56 days, inclusive, after Dose 3, had not received prohibited vaccines before blood draw at 1 month after Dose 3, and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Pneumococcal Serotype-specific IgG GMCs at 1 Month After Vaccination 4
outcome.description: IgG GMCs were determined for each of the 20 pneumococcal serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F and 33F.
outcome.population: Dose 4 evaluable immunogenicity population: eligible participants, randomly assigned to receive vaccine, aged 42-98 days on day of first vaccination, received all 4 doses of assigned vaccine, with Dose 4 received in defined window (365-386 days of age), had valid determinate IgG concentration for at least 1 serotype 1 month post dose 4,had blood collection within 27-56 days post Dose 4,had not received prohibited vaccines before blood draw at 1 month post Dose 4,had no major protocol deviations.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

measure.title: Pneumococcal Serotype-specific IgG GMCs at 1 Month After Vaccination 4
measure.description: IgG GMCs were determined for each of the 20 pneumococcal serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, 23F, 8, 10A, 11A, 12F, 15B, 22F and 33F.
measure.population: Dose 4 evaluable immunogenicity population: eligible participants, randomly assigned to receive vaccine, aged 42-98 days on day of first vaccination, received all 4 doses of assigned vaccine, with Dose 4 received in defined window (365-386 days of age), had valid determinate IgG concentration for at least 1 serotype 1 month post dose 4,had blood collection within 27-56 days post Dose 4,had not received prohibited vaccines before blood draw at 1 month post Dose 4,had no major protocol deviations.

reported_events.time_frame: Local reactions and Systemic events: within 7 days after each vaccination (systematic assessment), Non serious AEs: Vaccination 1 to 1 month after Vaccination 3 (up to 5 months) and Vaccination 4 to 1 month after Vaccination 4, SAEs: up to 16 months after Vaccination 1
reported_events.desc: Same event may appear as AE and SAE, what is presented are distinct events. Event may be categorized as serious in 1 participant and as non-serious in another participant or 1 participant may have experienced both serious and non-serious event during study. Overall safety analysis set was analyzed.

group.title: 20vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 20vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive a single 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of 13vPnC at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age (Dose/Vaccination 1, 2, 3, and 4, respectively).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
